title: NeuroPsyTools
text:
Welcome to NeuroPsyTools!
I created this space to bring together the web apps I‚Äôve developed for my clinical neuropsychology practice. While doing that, I thought it would also be cool to compile a directory of external resources showcasing the fantastic contributions others have made over the years.
If you have any suggestions for new web apps or know of any great resources to add to the directory, feel free to get in touch. I‚Äôm always up for exciting new projects and collaborations!
I‚Äôve got some ideas for future additions (like blogs, cheat sheets, and more), but I won‚Äôt get ahead of myself. Writing and programming take time, so updates may not happen frequently ‚Äî but stay tuned!
And if you like what you see - please share! ‚ô•Ô∏è
Last updated: 15 September 2024

title: NeuroPsyTools Apps
text:
These apps are all developed using Shiny, a web application framework for R that allows for the creation of interactive, user-friendly web applications.
Shiny apps enable users to input data, adjust parameters, and view results in real time, making them particularly useful for data analysis, visualisation, and reporting (and therefore clinical neuropsychology! üöÄ.
These apps were created with very limited developer time, so please be sure to read the disclaimers and use them at your own risk. If you notice anything amiss, feel free to leave a courteous message.
We‚Äôd love to hear your ideas for new clinical psychology apps, so don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out!












Divergence



Dissociation


Single-Case


Psychometrics



A Shiny App designed for the assessment of single cases, providing clinicians and researchers with functionalities to determine if there are deficits, discrepancies, or‚Ä¶













Score Converter



Data Visualisation


Single-Case


Test Scores



Score Converter is a shiny app that allows users to convert single test scores (using a web interface) or large batteries of test results (using spreadsheet upload). A suite‚Ä¶













Reliable Change



Reliable Change


Single-Case


Stability



Calculate reliable change indices (RCIs) for neuropsychological tests to assess significant changes in cognitive performance over time. A range of methodological approaches‚Ä¶













Therapy Outcomes



Therapy Outcomes


Effectiveness


Psychometrics



Therapy Outcomes is a shiny app that calculates the effectiveness of a therapy service based on basic descriptive statistics, before providing a benchmark performance‚Ä¶

title: Chris Gaskell
text: Chris Gaskell is a Senior Clinical Psychologist in Neuropsychology in the UK. When not working clinically he tends to been seen talking about his rescue dog (Leo) and making futile attempts at programming/web development.

title: Chris Gaskell
text:
Education
University of Sheffield, UK | DClinPsy in Clinical Psychology | Sept 2018 - Sept 2021
University of Chester, UK | BSc in Psychology | Sept 2010 - Sept 2013

title: Chris Gaskell
text:
Experience
NHS | Senior Clinical Psychologist | August 2022 - present
IndigoNeuro | Associate Psychologist | August 2020 - present
North West Neurotherapeutics | Associate Psychologist | August 2023 - present

The Lloyd & Preece Psychometric Auto-Scorer
Excel sheet designed by Dr Erin Lloyd and Dr David Preece, which auto-scores for a range of common psychological questionnaires.
Erin Lloyd, David Preece
















Podcasts


Tools and Applications for Clinical Neuropsychology.







Podcasts
Description
Contributor




NavNeuro
The podcast where they present cutting-edge scientific findings, discuss important topic areas, and interview brain-behavior experts.
John Bellone, Ryan Van Patten
















Tools


Tools and Applications for Clinical Neuropsychology.







Tool / App
Description
Contributor




Easy Report
Say goodbye to data cleaning and manual Excel tasks. Easy Report transforms reporting into a seamless, efficient process, allowing you to focus on delivering valuable insights.
Alexandra Davis


Reliable Change Calculators
A series of Excel sheets for easily calculating reliable change scores using manual entry of pre-populated for the RBANS
Kevin Duff


Calculators for Neuropsychology Practice
A huge range of downloadable (Windows) calculators for neuropsychology practice (e.g., regression, percentiles, single case-analysis, reliable change, supplementary test output etc.)
John Crawford and a series of co-authors.






Tutorials


Webinars


Tests


Tests for Clinical Neuropsychology.







Tests
Description
Contributor




Neuropsychological Test Database
This database includes information on 100+ neuropsychological tests/cognitive assessments, and self-report measures.
Georgia Dunning, Alistair Teager, Benjamin Dawson
